title: Add LFortran to Compiler Explorer
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/579

Here is the repository for Compiler Explorer: https://github.com/compiler-explorer/compiler-explorer

Here are instructions how to add a new compiler: https://github.com/compiler-explorer/compiler-explorer/blob/4cd659147f3dafec44b6937f5511c717ecbe6ee5/docs/AddingACompiler.md

In particular, we have to get it working with their infrastructure scripts locally first:

* https://github.com/compiler-explorer/compiler-explorer/blob/4cd659147f3dafec44b6937f5511c717ecbe6ee5/docs/AddingACompiler.md#adding-a-new-compiler-to-the-live-site
* https://github.com/compiler-explorer/infra

The compilers seem to be described in here:

* https://github.com/compiler-explorer/infra/tree/8cf5fcd7aae7f77e74c594764032890020b9dcf0/bin/yaml

It seems that they simply download a 64bit Linux binary and unpack it:

* https://github.com/compiler-explorer/infra/blob/8cf5fcd7aae7f77e74c594764032890020b9dcf0/bin/yaml/zig.yaml
* https://github.com/compiler-explorer/infra/blob/8cf5fcd7aae7f77e74c594764032890020b9dcf0/bin/yaml/go.yaml
* https://github.com/compiler-explorer/infra/blob/8cf5fcd7aae7f77e74c594764032890020b9dcf0/bin/yaml/rust.yaml

We build a Linux binary, but we need to test it more thoroughly and put it from GitLab's artifacts into our Downloads page. Also we'll see how stable we have to be with the compiler options. Until we reach version 1.0, we want to keep the freedom to change CLI options.
